Class TrigoFunController

java.lang.Object
main.java.com.team.game.controller.TrigoFunController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class TrigoFunController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Controller for the Trigonometry mini-game.

Handles question display, answer checking, scoring, timing, and database integration through GameService. This game challenges players with trigonometric problems drawn from QuestionBank, tracking their progress, accuracy, and performance within a time limit.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Called automatically when the FXML is loaded.

      Initializes the game by linking to the logged-in user, loading questions, starting a session, and beginning the timer.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • setDependencies

      public void setDependencies(GameService gameService, User currentUser)
      Injects the GameService and User for testing or manual setup.
      Parameters:
      gameService - active service façade
      currentUser - authenticated user (may be null in edge flows)

    • initializeFromLogin

      public void initializeFromLogin()
      Retrieves the active GameService and User.

      Prefers dependencies already injected via setDependencies(GameService, User) (useful for tests). If missing, falls back to Main.TrigoApp. Always touches currentUser.getUsername() to confirm wiring.

    • loadQuestionImage

      public void loadQuestionImage(String imageName)
      Loads an image for the current question from /images/.
      Parameters:
      imageName - the filename of the image to load

    • handleSubmitAnswer

      public void handleSubmitAnswer(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles submission of a user’s answer.

      Validates input, checks correctness, updates the score, saves results to the database, and transitions to the next question.

    • isAnswerCorrect

      public boolean isAnswerCorrect(String userAnswer, String correctAnswer)
      Compares user and correct answers after normalization.
      Parameters:
      userAnswer - raw user input
      correctAnswer - authoritative answer text
      Returns:
      true if answers are equivalent after normalization

    • normalizeAnswer

      public String normalizeAnswer(String answer)
      Normalizes an answer string to handle whitespace, decimals, radicals, and equivalent notations for flexible comparison.
      Parameters:
      answer - raw answer text
      Returns:
      normalized comparison form

    • handleNewGame

      public void handleNewGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles the “New Game” button action.

      Resets all state variables, restarts the session, and begins a new game cycle.
